RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 1 300 Y Dirt CR: 73. Allowance Purse 15120. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 124 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DOUBLE CRUISE broke alertly and held safely. SHE WEARS THE PANTZ finished gamely. SCARLETTS CARTEL away well and held for show. TIMBERS EXPRESS rallied late. FIRELICIOUS weakened late. WAVIN BAC ATYA lacked a rally.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 58. Claiming Purse 10000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,000 (Lesser Claiming Races For $3,500 (AB $4,500 ) At Century Mile Not Considered In Eligibility). Alberta Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SASSY CINDERELLA stalked from a rail position, shifted out to the three path, took over at the head of the stretch and won driving. ANNA'S IMAGE sent for early speed, sat just off the pace while three to four wide, chased in the final turn, and passed the tiring leader late for second. REBATE sat in striking distance from the five path, dropped back in the far turn, and bid belatedly to score for show. THIS TIME SWEETIE set the pace from the two path, and gave way at the head of the lane. LILBITSPICY was never far back, and failed to threaten in drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Sassy Cinderella
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, shifted out 3pth, won driving

ENTRY.NAME: Lilbitspicy
ENTRY.OWNER: C and H Duggan Farms Ltd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 15500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $16,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHE LOVES WINNIN broke outward then contested the early pace, gained a slim lead over DAZZLING MIST, was under pressure late stretch, and just held off rivals by the smallest margin after a multi-horse scramble to the wire. DAZZLING MIST returned to the paddock for a tack adjustment, pressed the pace from a rail position, angled out three to four wide at the head of the lane, dug in deep stretch, and lost the nod after a determined effort. MIDNIGHT GARDEN stalked the pacesetters, moved inside nearing the stretch and was outkicked, narrowly missing out. LITTLE HARPER squeezed out leaving the gate, trailed and passed tiring rival. FLORIST bumped LITTLE HARPER leaving the gate, chased four to five wide, and faded in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight Garden
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pacesetters, inside, outkicked, narrowly missed

ENTRY.NAME: Dazzling Mist
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed, angled out 3-4w, dug in, lost no

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 10000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,000 (Lesser Claiming Races For $3,500 (AB $4,500) At Century Mile Not Considered In E ligibility). Alberta Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PUMP THE BRAKES was quickest to the turn, drew clear nearing the quarter pole, opened up through the stretch under confident handling, and was ridden out while much the best. CHARMING VINTAGE bumped leaving, hustled away, dueled inside of CHRIS'S COMMAND through the stretch, and prevailed for place honors. CHRIS'S COMMAND sat just off the pacesetter, dueled determinedly outside CHARMING VINTAGE, and lost the bob. SMART CAT reared away from the gate, lodged a rail bid then flattened out in the stretch. AMEER came together with CHARMING VINTAGE, saved inside, shifted outside then was brushed by RUN ROSSO RUN at the head of the stretch, and lodged a mild late bid. RUN ROSSCO RUN tracked in the four path, drifted out at the head of the lane brushed AMEER, and yielded. CARAVAN PRINCE loaded without the rider, chased five wide and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Pump the Brakes
ENTRY.COMMENT: led, drew clear, opened up, ridden out

ENTRY.NAME: Charming Vintage
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, hustled away, dueled inside, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Ameer
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, saved, shifted out, brushed, mild late bid

ENTRY.NAME: Smart Cat
ENTRY.OWNER: Shot In The Dark Racing Corp.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 86. Starter Allowance Purse 15500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $8,000 (AB $10,000) OR LESS IN THEIR LAST THREE STARTS AND HAVE NOT WON A STARTER SINCE STARTING FOR CLAIMING PRICE OF $8,000 (AB $10,000) OR LESS. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WHERE'S THE GOLD broke alertly, trailed early from the five path, prompted action in the far turn, fanned four wide at the head of the lane, hooked up in a battle with MUCHO MAGIC matching strides late stretch, and refused to relinquish control after a long hard drive. MUCHO MAGIC reserved off the early pacesetters, was given cue when challenged by WHERE'S THE GOLD into the final turn, dueled inside through the stretch, dug in in the final yards but was narrowly denied. DAD'S LEGACY dueled for the lead inside of PRESS GANG, dropped back in the final turn, and finished well for show. PRESS GANG contested the pace, was unable to move on with rivals into the stretch and faded.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 6 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Maiden Claiming Purse 13500. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD THREE YEAR OLDS, 120 LBS.; OLDER, 125 LBS. Claiming Price $16,000 AB Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BARAK was reluctant to load, vied hard outside for the early lead while crossing over quickly on the field, emerged the leader into the far turn, drew clear into the stretch, and was kept to task. ADIOS Y GRACIAS vied inside, raced in tight quarters leaving the backstretch then was steadied, responded to encouragement into the stretch, and held for second. BOBS BUDDY steadied from the run away from the gate, stalked three wide, dueled outside of ADIOS Y GRACIAS through the stretch and was bested for second. TRAPEZE chased outside, and failed to threaten in the drive. TIMELY LIFE offered little. RAUSTY TREASURE was shuffled back in the early stages, and was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Adios Y Gracias
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson Linda Farr Gale and Edinger Brent
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied inside, in tight, steadied, rallied, held 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Rausty Treasure
ENTRY.OWNER: Workwize Ent Stables and Northern Hart Equestrian

ENTRY.NAME: Barak
ENTRY.COMMENT: reluctant, vied hard, drew clear, kept task

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 13500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR ALBERTA BREDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,000. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $ 15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ARGENTINA CRIES (IRE) quickly went to the front crossing over to the rail, drew clear in the far turn, was kept under steady handling into the stretch, and was ridden out under a brisk hand ride. MONEY MUNCHER exchanged bumps with EL FANTASMA in the early stages, hustled outside then brushed MOHAMED at the head of the lane, and closed late to get up for place. ABOVE AND BEYOND tracked inside, was brushed in close quarters leaving the backstretch, rallied inside of SPORTSCARR into the stretch, and was caught late. ESCROW STYLE lagged early, circled wide at the quarter pole then came together with EL FANTASMA, and rallied belatedly improving position late. MOHAMAD tracked outside in the five path early, was brushed after the quarter pole marker, and finished evenly. SPORTSCARR chased from between foes in the backstretch, angled to the two path into the far turn, went in pursuit of the leader, and came up empty for the drive. EL FANTASMA exchanged bumps at the start, stalked three wide then was squeezed out into the far turn, started to fade brushing ESCROW STYLE, and retreated soon after.

ENTRY.NAME: Above and Beyond
ENTRY.OWNER: C and H Duggan Farms Ltd
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, brushed, rallied inside, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Money Muncher
ENTRY.OWNER: C and H Duggan Farms Ltd
ENTRY.COMMENT: exchanged bumps, hustled outside, closed late

ENTRY.NAME: El Fantasma
ENTRY.COMMENT: exchanged bumps, stalked 3 wide, squeezed out, brushed,retreated

ENTRY.NAME: Escrow Style
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged early, circled wide, brushed, late rally

ENTRY.NAME: Argentina Cries (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: crossed over, drew clear, ridden out

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Claiming Purse 10000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $6,000. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FROSTEDBIRD fractious in the gate, vied hard outside for the early lead, dueled outside of PLUNGEINTOTHENITE leaving the backstretch, disposed of rival nearing the quarter pole, and drew clear late stretch under a strong hand ride. BRODY'S PAL took back leaving the chute, tracked from the four path, chased the leader into the stretch but was no match and finished up second best. REAL JUSTICE was checked leaving the chute, came under urging into the stretch but was no match for the two top finishers. WIZARDOFMENLOPARK drove five wide, closed gradually under steady handling, drifted in, in the late stages, and improved position. ZURI RISASI unhurried early, advanced inside through the final turn, rallied mildly in the stretch, and weakened late. SUNDAY SUNRISE angled into the four path in the backstretch, and lodged a mild late bid. PLUNGEINTOTHENITE vied hard from just off the rail, dueled leaving the backstretch, was unable to move on with rival nearing the quarter pole, and gave way. REMAIN CALM hustled away, and was outrun. NIGHTFALL shifted out to the five path in the backstretch, and lacked a bid. PRENTON was outrun throughout. ARTHUR FONZARELLI never reached contention.

ENTRY.NAME: Wizardofmenlopark
ENTRY.COMMENT: drove 5w, closed gradually, drifted in, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Frostedbird
ENTRY.OWNER: Highfield Investment Group Inc and Frey Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious, vied, dueled outside, drew clear
